column4: cumulative 2.500 GPA; and ACCT 23021 or ACTT 11001; not open to accounting (ACCT) majors.

column2: PROFESSIONAL ISSUES AND ETHICS IN ACCOUNTING
column4: Graduate standing and special approval.
column6: (Cross-listed with ACCT 73022) A capstone course for the MSA program. Investigates issues confronting the accounting profession today by reviewing the past, examining the present and looking into the future. Topics covered include history and characteristics of the profession, regulation of the profession, ethical challenges facing accountants and auditors, fraud and the future of the profession. Professional accounting research verbal, and written communication emphasized.

column4: graduate standing; and ACCT 43010 and ACCT 43014 or 53014.
column6: (Cross-listed with ACCT 73024) Examines the control and security of accounting information systems with an auditing perspective. Includes the role of IS audit function, IS auditing standards, system risks, application controls and current issues facing is auditors. Research, writing and ethics will be emphasized.

column2: ANALYSIS AND VALUATION OF BUSINESS USING FINANCIAL STATEMENTS
column4: ACCT 33001 or ACCT 63037; and graduate standing.
column6: (Cross-listed with ACCT 73025) Uses financial statements to analyze business stragety, accounting issues, finances and future prospects. Uses case studies to apply business valuation framework to security analysis, credit, corporate financing policies, and management communications. Research and writing will be emphasized.

column4: ACCT 33012; and graduate standing.
column6: (Cross-listed with ACCT 73030) Study of reporting in United States capital markets for domestic and foreign firms; evaluation of differences in accounting, auditing and financial reporting between nations; impact of international operations on accounting for decision making. Interpersonal skills emphasized.

column4: ACCT 43010; and graduate standing.
column6: (Cross-listed with ACCT 73031) Advanced conceptual and practical understanding of audit methodology and role of auditors. Focus on use of professional judgment in applying auditing standards on ethical considerations and on fraud. Review of current trends and developments in the public accounting profession. Written communication and ethical decision making emphasized.

column4: ACCT 33012 and graduate standing..
column6: (Cross-listed with ACCT 73032) Survey of history of accounting and development of principles, followed by intensive study of theoretical problems related to determination of income and presentation of financial position. International and current issues also discussed. Written communication and ethical decision making emphasized.

column4: Open only to MBA and MA students; and graduate standing. Cannot be used toward MSA degree.
column6: (Cross-listed with ACCT 73037) In-depth study of financial accounting concepts and basic financial statements. Examination of significant accounting issues affecting financial reporting and their impact on analysis and interpretation of financial information for decision making.

column2: ACCOUNTING FOR MANAGERIAL ACTION AND EVALUATION
column4: ACCT 63037 or 73037; and MBA and MA students only; and graduate standing. Cannot be used toward MSA degree.
column6: (Cross-listed with ACCT 73038) Review of cost accounting concepts and cost behavior. In-depth study of analyzing costs for pricing and product mix decisions; activity based cost systems; budgeting; planning and control issues; methods of remaining competitive in a global environment; compensation issues.

column4: ACCT 43031 and graduate standing.

column4: ACCT 43033 or ACCT 53033; and graduate standing.
column6: An in-depth study of formation, operation, termination and liquidation and other special problems of partnerships. Tax research and verbal and written communication emphasized.

column6: Tax planning; research methodology and problems. Tax research and verbal and written communications emphasized.
